Cipio Coin App

Cipio Coin App is a cryptocurrency fintech application I built for a startup to induce use cases for their token, based on the Binance Smart Chain. I developed it from scratch using Moralis Ethereum Boilerplate to handle crypto payments. It was both a challenging and good learning experience.

Live

View Site

TYPE

Contract

STACK

React

Context API

Tailwind CSS

Moralis Ethereum Boilerplate

Web Stack and Explanation

Since Moralis had an Ethereum Boilerplate for React, all I had to do was edit out the functionalities I didn't need and add new features specific to the app. I used Tailwind to style the components, React Router v6 for navigation, and the Context API to manage transaction states across multiple pages.

The core features of the app are to debit the user's cryptocurrency wallet and automatically credit their mobile line or TV decoder (depending on the user's need) in local currency. So, I also used the VTU API (vtu.ng) to automate the Naira payment.

Problems and Thought Process

When the company approached me with this project, I had no idea what Moralis was. One of the challenges of building the app was familiarizing myself with Moralis web3.0 technologies through their documentation.

Also, since Moralis used v5 of React Router, I had to update it to v6, which is more efficient and easy to use.

Lessons Learned

This project seemed impossible at first. However, the longer I focused on how to bring it to life, the more solutions popped up. One of the best lessons I learned while building this project is that patience and problem solving skills are crucial to my success as a programmer.
